function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Limited number of behaviors studied in relation to covid-19 and travel anxiety","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Need for effective approaches to reduce travel-related risk perception and anxiety due to covid-19 and similar health risk situations","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Conflict of interest declaration is missing","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Variability in contact rates based on age, sex, employment status, and other characteristics","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Using spatially-resolved census data to infer transportation patterns in cities for urban health simulations","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Characterizing the role of urban design in disease spread using a specific metropolitan area as an example","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Running simulations in hypothetical cities to demonstrate the impact of spatial distributions of housing, education, and economic activities on epidemics","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inferred mobility patterns based on high-resolution maps of residential density","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Calculation of trip attraction strength tas based on education and economic activities","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integration of mobility patterns into epidemiological transmission models","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Segregation of population under sir transmission scheme","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Heterogeneous contact networks through which diseases are spread","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Expected number of si contacts occurring at specific locations","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Calculating the reproductive number in the context of disease transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Interaction between susceptible subgroup and infectives with age-specific transmission potential","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Linear relationship between contact rates and visitor density","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spatial variations in the basic reproduction number r0","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased contact rates in downtown residents led to 50% more efficient spread of pathogens","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Statistical dependence of disease spread on distance from city’s largest retail hub","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relocating businesses, schools, and housing across cities with unique transportation networks may impact the growth rate and evolution of epidemics","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate prediction of attack rates compared to observed data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Unequal roles of individuals in disease spreading based on location","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variability in efficiency of vaccination campaigns based on location","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inequalities in health impacts across different neighborhoods due to remote influence of people in other neighborhoods and characteristics of places where interactions occur","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited representation of non-residential processes in disease transmission models may impact the accuracy of environmental health impact assessments","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of isolation of the effects of spatial heterogeneity from all other information embedded in massive mobility datasets used as model input","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Centralization of daily activities in hyper-affluent areas leading to potential interaction among people from all parts of the city","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uneven distributions of daily activities can lead to segregated subsets of the population, increasing the growth rate of infectious outbreaks","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Centralization of daily activities can result in higher r0 for urban epidemics, leading to increased spread of contagious diseases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of effect on children’s r0 due to the breakup of activity hubs, potentially leading to targeted spread of contagious diseases among children","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited accessibility of massive mobility datasets","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for asymptomatic periods in disease spread modeling","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neglect of reactive behavior in disease spread modeling","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of mobility and contact data for infants and children at different educational stages","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduction in public transport ridership","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mass unemployment and increase in home working","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Decrease in air and noise pollution","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of novel human coronavirus due to hypermobility and interconnectedness of transport networks","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate existing transport policy approaches to respond to the new challenges posed by covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of recognition of the important role of individual choice and actions in delivering socially desired transport outcomes in a post-covid world","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Asymptomatic travelers exporting infection undetected across international borders","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of covid-19 to most countries on earth","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relaxation of restrictions and social distancing measures without proper precautions","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Individuals not following public health guidelines","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Panic buying and hoarding in supermarkets","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependency on online shopping and home deliveries","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased movement of people and goods may lead to the spread of contagious diseases","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Encouraging people to return to work and use private vehicles may increase the risk of contagious disease transmission in public spaces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased use of public transport and active travel may lead to overcrowding in public spaces, increasing the risk of contagious disease transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited accessibility to active travel options such as walking and cycling","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"}]}
